args.natural_language_statement: Suppose X and Y are topological spaces and A ⊂ X is dense. Prove that the inclusion of C(Y) → C(X × Y) is an isomorphism onto the functions which are constant on each set {x} × Y with x ∈ X. Translate this into Lean4 (statement only, no proof). Here C(Z) denotes the space of continuous real-valued functions on Z (i.e. continuous maps Z → ℝ). Include hypotheses: topological_space X, topological_space Y, A : Set X, Dense A. Use the map C(Y) → C(X × Y) given by precomposition with Prod.fst or Prod.snd as appropriate. End the theorem with := by sorry. Use Mathlib import at top and name the file benmckay_top_topology_262.lean.

args.content:
import Mathlib

theorem benmckay_top_topology_262 {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (A : Set X) (hA : Dense A) :
  (fun g : ContinuousMap Y ℝ => g.comp ContinuousMap.snd).range =
    { f : ContinuousMap (X × Y) ℝ | ∀ x y1 y2, f (x, y1) = f (x, y2) } := by sorry

import Mathlib

theorem benmckay_top_topology_262 {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (A : Set X) (hA : Dense A) :
  Set.range (fun g : ContinuousMap Y ℝ => g.comp (ContinuousMap.snd : ContinuousMap (X × Y) Y)) =
    { f : ContinuousMap (X × Y) ℝ | ∀ x y1 y2, f (x, y1) = f (x, y2) } := by sorry
